alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Southern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 8:17PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Meade, northwestern Custer, southern Lawrence and southwestern Pennington Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 817 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near O`Neil Pass to Deerfield to 4 miles west of Bear Mountain Lookout. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lead, Hill City, Deadwood, Johnson Siding, Nemo, Central City, Hisega, Silver City, Rochford, Flag Mountain, Mystic, Moon, Brownsville, Galena, Rockerville, Deerfield, Cheyenne Crossing, Deerfield Reservoir, Pactola Reservoir and O`Neil Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for southwestern and west central South Dakota...and northeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills; Southern Black Hills
